intro: Conostylis caricina subsp. caricina, commonly known as the narrow-leaf conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, often arranged in dense inflorescences. It is typically found in sandy or gravelly soils in coastal and semi-arid regions. This species is adapted to drought and full sun, making it a hardy plant in arid environments.
